result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery M Robers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffery M Robers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffery M Robers was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Filed by Atty Corey Chirafisi
Filed by Atty Corey Chirafisi

Defendant Jeffery M Robers in court with attorney Corey Chirafisi.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 1 & 3 Dismissed.  15TR1399 Dismissed.  On Ct. 2 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 18 months.  Conditions of probation include: $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  No jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 29, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant, Jeffery M Robers, appeared pro se. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $2,000 recog. bond with felony conds.
